cyclone.name: Eta
cyclone.current_location: about 195 mi WSW of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to cross central Cuba tonight, then turn north-northwest Sunday and west Monday, tracking toward the Florida Keys / far South-Florida and then into the southeast Gulf of Mexico.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the Florida Keys / extreme South-Florida coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane & storm-surge watches limited to South-Florida/Florida Keys; tropical-storm watches north to the Brevard-Volusia County line on Florida’s east coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings cover Cuba, NW Bahamas, and South-Florida/Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-Florida, Florida Keys, portions of the Florida Gulf Coast and eastern Gulf waters; minor surge possible as far north as Altamaha Sound, GA
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤8%) of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely breezy conditions <34 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Guidance shows 2–3 ft surge possible south of Altamaha Sound; at Savannah, 1–2 ft minor coastal flooding cannot be ruled out at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain 1–3 in possible mid-week as Eta’s remnant moisture passes inland.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and higher than normal waves along Georgia beaches mid-week.
